meanings.sent1: The tiny bird had an embryonic beak.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the embryonic development of the frog.
meanings.sent3: The embryonic idea of a flying car made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her love for painting was still in its embryonic stage.
meanings.sent5: The embryonic plant struggled to break through the soil.

meanings.definition: In an early stage of development.
meanings.sent1: The project was still in its embryonic phase.
meanings.sent2: The company focused on nurturing embryonic talent.
meanings.sent3: The embryonic plan for a surprise party was almost ruined.
meanings.sent4: His embryonic skills in cooking were starting to show promise.
meanings.sent5: The embryonic buds on the tree signaled the arrival of spring.

meanings.sent1: The fish had an embryonic tail.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the embryonic features of the baby in the portrait.
meanings.sent3: The embryonic resemblance between the twins was striking.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an embryonic quality that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent5: The embryonic wings of the butterfly were delicate and beautiful.
